title: MCl gravimetric analysis - identify metal chloride

content.description:
The following questions refer to the below.

M+ is an unknown metal cation with a +1 charge. A student dissolves the chloride of the unknown metal, MCl, in enough water to make 100.0 mL of solution. The student then mixes the solution with excess AgNO3 solution, causing AgCl to precipitate. The student collects the precipitate by filtration, dries it, and records the data shown below. (The molar mass of AgCl is 143 g/mol.)

Mass of unknown chloride, MCl
 0.74 g

Mass of filter paper
 0.80 g

Mass of filter paper plus AgCl precipitate
 2.23 g
content.question: What is the identity of the metal chloride?

skill.text: 5.F: Calculate, estimate, or predict an unknown quantity from known quantities by selecting and following a logical computational pathway and attending to precision (e.g., performing dimensional analysis and attending to significant figures).
